reviews.review_msg: Super reasonable professor, really respectful and considerate to the opinions and views of the class, especially with Covid. I would take another class with her and highly recommend. Grading was very fair, and lectures were cool

Personally, I think she's alright, explains things at a steady pace which is nice. There was a midterm feedback she asked us to do and I really put my thoughts into it, only for it to be ignored. The final exam time was shortened twice and the day was shifted to an inconvenient one without asking students. Questions answered if they are popular.

I love this professor. This is my second time taking this course with her. I find the content a little hard but it is so much better when she explains and the lab assignments really help. Her ta for this course is also so helpful. She is so caring and understanding and really does try to make things easier especially during covid. not a hard grader

Honestly the labs were the hardest part of this class, because one of the TA's marked way more harshly than the other TA. However, Kirsten is an amazing prof with so much knowledge about the climate. She's really easy to talk to, and helpful when you have questions. Make sure test answers are given in the way she explains them!
Lab assignments are vague and misleading due to the wordings of its questions. Rather than being straightforward, exam questions attempt to trick you with its wording as well.

She was one of the best profs Ive had! I absolutely love the content and the way she teaches. Labs are easy, but tests are more difficult. You have to study well, and in advance to get a good mark. But its worth it! 314 definitely my favourite coure so far
Great prof. Pay attention in class. Explains concepts clearly. Hard marker though.
Kirsten is a great teacher. Explains topics so you will understand them and reinforces it with her lab assignments. Tests are long and you better know some details but overall they are fair.

If you took GEOG214 then you should know that "climate" is different than "weather". So if you are expecting to learn any weather forecast stuff then you are in the wrong class. GEOG314 is all about CLIMATE which means it focuses on global scale energy balance (like ocean currents and climate change). The prof is very nice but exams are tough.
